DataElement.preferredName: Breast Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the breast carcinoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to clinical M stage for a breast tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/17/17 tt associated with CS/CSI. 9/13/17 tt transferred context; changed def - 1st letter upper case; changed Reg Status to Qualified. CSI? "

ValueDomain.preferredName: Breast Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with distant detectable metastases as determined by classic clinical and radiographic means and/or histologically proven larger than 0.2 mm. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with distant detectable metastases as determined by classic clinical and radiographic means and/or histologically proven larger than 0.2 mm. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer cM0(i+) TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer cM0(i+) TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer in which there is no clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases, but deposits of molecularly or microscopically detected tumor cells in circulating blood, bone marrow, or other nonregional nodal tissue that are no larger than 0.2 mm in a patient without symptoms or signs of metastases. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer cM0(i+) TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer in which there is no clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases, but deposits of molecularly or microscopically detected tumor cells in circulating blood, bone marrow, or other nonregional nodal tissue that are no larger than 0.2 mm in a patient without symptoms or signs of metastases. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer in which there is no clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer in which there is no clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer Clinical Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
